alert.note: Alert for San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 02 at 4:53PM CST until March 02 at 5:30PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CST FOR BROWN...EASTERN COLEMAN...CENTRAL MCCULLOCH AND SAN SABA COUNTIES... At 451 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rising Star to near Grosvenor to Bangs to near Rockwood to near Brady Lake, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Bangs, Grosvenor, Cross Cut, Lake Brownwood and Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty around 455 PM CST. Brownwood, Byrds and Lake Brownwood State Park around 500 PM CST. Camp Bowie and Winchell around 505 PM CST. Early, Brookesmith and May around 510 PM CST. Blanket and Zephyr around 515 PM CST. Sloan around 530 PM CST. Algerita around 535 PM CST. San Saba around 545 PM CST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Fife, Locker, Us-283 Near The Mcculloch-Coleman County Line, Harkeyville, Owens, Milburn, Whon, Spring Creek, Thrifty and Us-190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
